textos_fuente.text: Glades Pioneer Park - Palm Beach County Sports Commission Hotels Giving Back Videos Gallery Careers Grant Application Donate Member Login About Us About Us Board and Committees Staff Pay Dues Online Grant Application Brand Assets Meeting Notices Facilities All Facilities Hotels Facility Guide Events Upcoming Events The Ultimate Weeks of Sport are Coming to The Palm Beaches The Palm Beach County Sports Hall of Fame The Palm Beaches Golf Classic Kids Fitness Festival of The Palm Beaches Holiday Basketball Classic of The Palm Beaches Lou Groza Award Celebration News The Palm Beaches Play in The Palm Beaches Discover the Palm Beaches Golf Palm Beaches TV Hotels Get Involved Memberships Volunteer Opportunities Support Sports License Tags Contact Us Glades Pioneer Park 866 S.R. 715, Belle Glade, FL 33430 Multi-Sport This versatile park in the wide-open western communities of Palm Beach County made headlines in recent years, thanks to the Orange Bowl Committee‚Äôs selection of the park for its fifth legacy gift to the South Florida sports community. Funded with a $3 million investment, the Orange Bowl Field at Glades Pioneer Park opened in 2018, and is a regional, state-of-the-art gem for events. The park also features four basketball courts, a baseball diamond, two softball fields, two tennis courts, two sand volleyball courts, a picnic pavilion and a playground. It also is home to the Pioneer Park Aquatic Center‚Äîcomplete with a 25-yard pool with water slides, tipping buckets and other ‚Äúplay‚Äù features. SCHEDULE A TOUR GET DIRECTIONS AMENITIES Distance to PBI Airport: 44 miles Hours of Operation: 6:30 a.m.-6:30 p.m., lighted court facilities open until 9 p.m., lighted athletic fields open until 10 p.m. Total Space: 64.2 acres Facility Type: Pool; Fields; Outdoors; Special You may also be interested in.... Baseball Roger Dean Chevrolet Stadium Jupiter, FL View More Multi-Sport CACTI Park of The Palm Beaches West Palm Beach, FL View More Just Bring Your Game! We would love to hear about your event. Palm Beach County Day 2026 PBC Day 2026 January 13 - 14 Newsletter ¬ª Sign Up Save the Date Gallery PBC Day 2025 Twitter Facebook Instagram Email Countdown to PBC Day 2026 days Hours Minutes Seconds About PBC Day 2025 Bringing The Sunshine PBC Administrator Verdenia Baker and Ed Chase, Director of Intergovernmental Affairs and Community Engagement. Palm Beach County Day 2025 celebrated the county√¢¬Ä¬ôs sunshine state of mind by
		bringing our brightest and best to Tallahassee. However, two of our brightest and
		best will be retiring before the next Palm Beach County Day. County Administrator Verdenia Baker retired on May 31 after 38 years of service to the residents of Palm Beach County and nearly 10 years as its Administrator. Mrs. Baker√¢¬Ä¬ôs service has helped make Palm Beach County a strong government with many resources. Ed Chase has played an essential role in Palm Beach County for decades. As the
		Director of Intergovernmental Affairs and Community Engagement, he has led our
		lobbying efforts in Tallahassee and coordinated our lobby teams throughout the
		year. Ed and Verdenia√¢¬Ä¬ôs efforts have forged Palm Beach County√¢¬Ä¬ôs lobbying presence in
		Tallahassee and have been essential in promoting the county to state lawmakers.
		We wish them both a happy retirement. A special thank you to our sponsors who made the events happen. Also, thank
		you to all of our attendees. Planning for next year is underway, and we hope you
		will start thinking ahead about sponsoring and attending Palm Beach County Day,
		which will take place Jan. 13-14, 2026. 2025 Wrap Video Save the Date Palm Beach County Board of County Commissioners Maria G. Marino, Mayor, Sara Baxter, Vice Mayor, Gregg K. Weiss, Joel G. Flores, Marci Woodward, Maria Sachs, Bobby Powell Jr. County Administrator Joe Abruzzo Intergovernmental Affairs & Community Engagement Director Kasey Denny Legislative Affairs Vacant, Director Public Affairs Lisa De La Rionda, Director 2025 Photos FAU President Adam Hasner. FPL External Affairs Manager Ilan Kaufer. FAU√¢¬Ä¬ôs Cara Perry and Camila Mychalczuk with Patti Hamilton of Coastal Waste and Recycling. PBC Day 2025 - The Palm Beaches Michael Zeff of the Chamber of Commerce of the Palm Beaches, Michael Davis of WGI, PBC Mayor Maria Marino, Senator Gayle Harrell and Nathan Green of Vanderbilt University. PBC Vice Mayor Sara Baxter with PBC Firefighters. PBC Administrator Verdenia Baker, Commissioner Bobby Powell Jr. and Assistant County Administrator Dr. Isami Ayala-Collazo. PBC Commissioner Joel G. Flores and Dana Herst of Nicholas Children√¢¬Ä¬ôs Health System. Government Law Group√¢¬Ä¬ôs Neil Schiller, Peter Sachs, PBC Commissioner Maria Sachs and Village of Wellington Councilman John McGovern. Representative Pat Maney, PBC Legislative Affairs√¢¬Ä¬ô Director Kasey Denny and PBC Commissioner Gregg K. Weiss. PBC Commissioner Marci Woodward with State Attorney for Florida√¢¬Ä¬ôs 15th Judicial Circuit Alexcia Cox. Representative Joe Casello with PBC Deputy County Administrator Patrick Rutter. Kicking off Palm Beach County Day at the Florida Association of Counties breakfast. Discover√¢¬Ä¬ôs √¢¬Ä¬úLove The Palm Beaches√¢¬Ä¬ù in the Capitol Courtyard. Palm Beach County Day participants in the Capitol Rotunda. PBC Assistant County Administrator Todd Bonlarron and Supervisor of Elections Wendy Sartory Link. Representative Mike Caruso with Solid Waste Authority of Palm Beach County Willie Puz. Discover The Palm Beaches Milton Segarra, Erika Constantine and Sergio Piedra. PBC Public Affairs√¢¬Ä¬ô Kelley Burke with several of the sponsors √Ø¬ª¬øthat made Palm Beach County Day 2025 possible. ¬© 2025 Palm Beach County Public Affairs

Item Rate Type Camp Sites without Electric $20 plus tax Daily Camp Sites without Electric $350 plus tax Monthly Camp Sites with Electric $25 plus tax Daily Camp Sites with Electric $450 plus tax Monthly Extra Person $2 plus tax Daily Extra Person $10 plus tax Weekly Extra Person $25 plus tax Monthly Picnic Shelters (not reserved) Free Picnic Shelters (reserved) $50 plus tax Daily Pavilion $250 plus tax $150 refundable deposit required Daily Nickerson/Ulrich Building $450 plus tax $250 refundable deposit required Daily Real-Time Weather Data To view real time weather at Pioneer Park visit http://hardee.weatherstem.com/fswnzolfosprings Park Rules In order to make your stay more pleasant, we invite your attention to the following Park Rules. Pioneer Park is owned and operated by County Government. Therefore, all camping units must display a current tag, readily visible to management. No reservations. Camp in designated sites only . One camping unit & one vehicle allowed per campsite. Camping unit and/or RV must be kept clean and in a good state of repair, which includes: Clean; free of dirt, mold, and mildew. Tarps will only be allowed for 14 days during construction/repair. All campers/RVs entering Pioneer Park must be in good condition. All body work must be clean and in good repair. The camper/RV must be free from damage, rust, mold, and dirt. All awnings and equipment must be well maintained without any visible damage. No ropes or wires shall be attached to trees or buildings. Doormat shall be no larger than 3‚Äôx 4‚Äô. All trash must be placed in garbage cans or dumpsters provided. Dump station is located at the west end of the park. No water is allowed to be dumped on the ground. (washing of vehicles, trailers, or motor homes is prohibited) No boards, pallets, blocks, or other such items on the grass. All items outside on camp site will be arranged in a neat and orderly fashion. Camp fires are allowed, but please be careful. All camp sites must be left clean & neat upon departure. Restrooms with showers are available to registered campers. Showers are available to non-campers for a $2.00 fee per shower to be paid at the park Office. Children are the responsibility of the parent/guardian at all times. Pets (two per camp site) are welcome, but must be on a leash (not to exceed ten feet) at all times. Pets are not allowed inside park buildings or near the Wildlife Refuge area. Do not leave pets unattended. Pet disturbance will NOT be tolerated at any time. ALL PET WASTE MUST BE CLEANED UP BY THE PET OWNER! No swimming in any waters of the park. Fishing is allowed from the banks of Pioneer Lake, Rock Lake, & Peace River. Boats are allowed on Peace River only. Boat ramp is available. Quiet time in the park is between the hours of 10:00 pm until 8:00 am. Please be respectful of other campers. Park management reserves the right to ask any camper to vacate the park premises at any time, for any reason, including but not limited to violations of park rules, disruptive behavior, safety concerns, or any actions that may negatively impact the experience or well-being of other guests. Compliance with all park regulations is expected to ensure a safe and enjoyable environment for all visitors. Contact Information Dwight Flowers ‚Äì Park Manager dwight.flowers@hardeecountyfl.gov Park Manager Phone ‚Äì (863) 449-7263 Ben Willis ‚Äì Parks & Recreation Superintendent ben.willis@hardeecountyfl.gov Pioneer Park Office 231 Wilbur C. King Blvd Zolfo Springs, FL 33890 Park Phone (863) 473-5078 Park Building Rentals (863) 473-5076 Hours of Operation Daily 7 AM ‚Äì 6 PM Parks & Recreation Cracker Trail Museum Hardee Lakes Pioneer Park Wildlife Refuge Phone Directory Call Us Office Mon-Thurs: 8 AM - 5 PM Fri: 8 AM - 4 PM County Calendar Important

Jobs - View jobs Location New York Jobs Types - Jobs - View jobs image/svg+xml ` Pioneer Healthcare Services: Committed to Your Success Pioneer Healthcare Services was founded on a simple yet powerful belief: staffing should be personal. Since 2012, we've been committed to creating meaningful connections, ensuring professionals in healthcare and education find roles that truly align with their goals. Backed by over 50 years of combined industry experience, we bring deep expertise and insight to every placement. More than just matching jobs, we focus on your passion, offering mentorship, flexibility, and room to grow. As a Joint Commission-accredited, minority-owned firm, we take pride in our industry recognition and people-first approach. Let‚Äôs build your future together, with purpose, care, and connection. Learn More Your Trusted Career Partner More than just staffing, we help build careers, strengthen teams, and create lasting professional relationships. Personalized Career Support We prioritize your personal and professional career goals, offering mentorship, guidance, and opportunities that align with your passion. Compensation & Benefits Enjoy market-leading compensation, comprehensive benefits, and support for licensure and professional development. Trusted Partnerships We connect you with school districts and healthcare facilities that value your skills and contributions. Work-Life Balance Recognizing the value of flexibility, we strive to match you with roles that align with your lifestyle and needs. Supportive Community Join a team that values diversity, inclusivity, and fostering meaningful connections between professionals and clients. Finding the Perfect Fit Finding the right match goes beyond staffing, ensuring professionals thrive in roles leading to long-term success and fulfillment for candidates and clients. Supporting Your Journey, Every Step of the Way Get Started with a Recruiter 01 Share your background, career goals, and what your ideal assignment looks like. Your dedicated recruiter will take the time to understand your needs and match you with the best local or travel opportunities that align with your aspirations. Navigate Your Job Search 02 From applications to interview prep, we guide you through every step of the process. Once you find the proper role, we assist with reviewing offers, negotiating when needed, and ensuring a smooth licensing and credentialing process. Begin Your Journey Confidently 03 Start your assignment with full support. From onboarding and housing assistance to 24/7 recruiter access and ongoing mentorship, we‚Äôre with you every step of the way, ready to help you plan your next move when you‚Äôre ready. About us 1940 Wilson Street, Hollywood, FL 33020 +1 754-423-0558 info@gladescs.com Login Site Web Search Home Services - More information Corporations vs LLC About Contact All About Us Glades running with the goal to provide our Clients not only expertise and advice on company matters but also accounting and legal counseling through independent accredited professionals. Glades Company Services, previously Glades Corporate Services LLC, was founded in January of 2012. Glades was created with the goal to provide our Clients not only expertise and advice on company matters but also accounting and legal counseling through independent accredited professionals. Glades has developed strategic alliances with accounting firms in order to get for our clients the best advice ¬†before making the decision to form a company. Glades‚Äô Team Leader and Managing Member is Elena Diaz. She is an Argentinean attorney at law. Elena has practiced her profession in Buenos Aires for more than 25 years.
